To describe the spatial distribution of heat stress around the world, we used three thresholds linked to international
23 and national
24 heat stress protection recommendations for working people. These risk thresholds are reached when the monthly mean of daily maximum WBGT in the hottest month exceeds 26°C (moderate), 30°C (high), or 34°C (extreme) in non-cooled workplaces.
